 I think it's important to be specific about who we're talking about here- most child molesters do not fulfill the requirements to be considered "pedophiles". To equate the two is to allow most child molestors to hide behind the spectre of pedophiles.
 
 
About 95% of victims know their perpetrators. 
 Source: CCPCA, 1992
 
 
 One of the myths regarding child molesters is that they "look different" or behave differently from others in some way. Here are some statistics describing child molesters:
 
 97% are male 
 91% are heterosexual 
 91% are religious 
 75% are married or formerly married 
 73% are Caucasian 
 65% earn a middle income or above 
 48% are college educated 
 Source: This information was adapted from The Medlin Training Institute website, sexualdeviancy.com

 
 Keep in mind that the available statistics on reported sexual assault of minors will always present a skewed image, because- 
Ninety percent of sexual abuse victims never tell.
 Susan Forward, Ph.D., 1989.
 Innocence and Betrayal Overcoming the Legacy of Sexual Abuse.
 
 
 The differences between most child molesters and actual pedophiles are:
 
 -Pedophiles usually are only sexually interested in children. Most child molesters primarily engage in adult heterosexual relations.
 
 -Pedophiles stalk and attack large numbers of children (hundreds), whereas most child molesters abuse children in their proximity (often dozens instead of hundreds). Of course, one molested child is too many.
 
 -Pedophiles are less likely to have known the child personally, whereas most child molesters are trusted family members or friends of the family.
 
 -Pedophiles are usually single, isolated and socially awkward, whereas most child molesters have families and are considered "friendly" and "good citizens".
 
 I'm not outlining these differences to argue that most child molesters can be "reformed", I don't know. I do think that less children would be abused if people stopped believing that the "pervert in the bushes" were more dangerous than the people in their families.
 
 I do think pedophiles are seriously dangerous individuals, who cause tremendous damage. I think they're kind of like serial killers. A dead person is a dead person, whether they died because of a "run of the mill" murder or because of a serial killer. However, there are differences between how these people should be dealt with and how we can protect ourselves (and the people we love) from them.
 
 I think we should focus more attention on preventing abuse and helping survivors, instead of deciding how to best punish offenders.

I didn't read all the posts. There were so many.
 
 I think the original question is making sweeping black-and-white statements about something that is far from black and white.
 
 There are a few things to think about before we can decide what to do with "child molesters."
 
 We'd have to define exactly what constitutes "molestation" and what constitutes a "child".
 
 I mean I've heard stories of say a 19-20 yo male having consensual sex with a 13-14 year old girl, and that was called "child molestation." Ok, so maybe the guy made a bad judgement, maybe she lied about her age, whatever, but should we cut the guys balls off? Should he get the death penalty? What punishment does she get? Was she "molested"?
 
 Personally I don't consider a 14 year old a "child." Maybe they are YOUR child, but honestly they are old enough to make their own decisions (as poor as they may be). But, hey, who can decide when a person is old enough to make their own decisions? The legal cutoff is usually 18. Does an 18 year old make better decisions than a 14 year old? (I sure as hell didn't.) 
 
 With that said, I think the type of child molestation you were referring to was when a full adult rapes or sexually abuses a small child. While this is pretty damned heinous, is death the answer? What if the abuser is the child's father? Would the child chose the death penalty for the father, or castration?
 
 The problem is not so cut and dry as some of the posts here have laid it out.
 
 I had a relative by marriage who sexually abused his children (my cousins). I don't know the details, I just know something happened over a period of time. All the kids turned out nutty, as in they now have many mental problems. You want to know what his punishment was? Five years probation. That's it.

First, I believe this thread, and similar threads all over the Internet, whenever the discussion occurs, is the best proof of why death sentence should be, at the very least, avouded, especially in cases of child molestation. People completely lose control. Prejudice forms instantly, as do calls for the most excessive punishments. This is intolerable. Moral panic suspends rationality and can lead to false convictions. Minds must be calmed first, only then can wise decisions be made. It is often pointed out that pepole will care more about their dog than about a starving african baby. Thus, people so often change persectives when one of their own close relatives is a victim of anything ("You just don't understand! If it were your wife that has been raped, you'd want to kill the #%( rapist too!"). Just because we are all protective of children in general (which is the reason for the intense reaction) does not mean that the same reasons for which a calm, impartial mind should decide on punishments of other crimes should not apply to child molestation.
 
 Second, cruel punishments make for cruel people. In criminals, people with nothing to lose are dangerous, more likely to be drawn to excessive expansion of their acts. In the rest of the society, the social acceptance of cruelty is elevated. Both are a highly negative element.
 
 Third, the crime is too singled out. To the victim, the rape of a child is no worse than the rape of an adult. Both are scarred for life. Thus, we get back to the big problem of setting punishments. Is murder worse than rape, or worse than torturing the victim for days without killing them, or than breaking one's neck, leaving him a tetraplegic, ... 
 
 Fourth, a year of prison is not nothing. For a typical criminal, twenty years already takes away your productive and enjoyable life, leaving you only old age. Think about this, with a calm mind.
 
 And last, I'm not so sure about the "incurable" status. Here, terms get mixed up. Paedophilia simply means attraction to children, and not all paedophiles are actually child molesters. So if paedophilia (simply feeling attraction) is incurable, is the willingness to actually act upon the impulse also incorrigible?
